text: United Nations has just issued its
report on the murder of jamal [ __ ] the
saudi journalist was killed in the Saudi
consulate and Istanbul in October last
year the CIA and some Western countries
believe Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman
Saudi Arabia's de facto ruler ordered
the killing Saudi officials have always
denied this diplomatic correspondent
Caroline Hawley has been looking at the
report it's a long one hundred pages
Caroline I know you're making your way
through that's right one of the key
points you've seen so far from the key
points is that the report is categorical
that blame for the extrajudicial killing
of Jamal casualties lies with the state
of Saudi Arabia of the Kingdom of Saudi
Arabia and then there's the question of
how high that responsibility went and
the report says further investigation is
needed but the Special Rapporteur says
there is credible evidence of high-level
Saudi officials individual liability
including Crown Prince Mohammed bin
Salman which needs further investigation
so that is a key point she goes on to
say that the investigations by Turkey
and Saudi Arabia into the death didn't
meet international standards
Turkey's investigation was limited in
time they were not allowed to drain a
well located in the consul's residence
and they also say that the Saudis
obstructed the investigation she found
that the crime scenes had been
thoroughly even forensic ly cleaned so
suggesting that the Saudis had not acted
in good faith and then there is a trial
currently underway in Saudi Arabia
has she said anything about that yes
she's been very critical of that she
says it doesn't meet international
standards and that that should be
suspended I believe it's about two dozen
people have been in custody five have
been sentenced to death but she has been
extremely critical of the judicial
process in Saudi Arabia and now suggests
that it should be the crime should be
internationally investing and so what
does that mean does that mean that there
could be a prosecution from say the
United States where mr. [ __ ] lived well
that is her suggestion one of her
recommendations is that the FBI start
investigating and
and that if if needed if appropriate
there should be criminal prosecutions so
in a sense this doesn't tell us anything
that we didn't already know the report
but it's very very strong in its
language it is very very damning about
the investigations that have happened so
far and what of the Saudis always said
about some of those allegations they
have denied that that it was officially
sanctioned certainly that it was
sanctioned by Mohammed bin Salman
Mohammed bin Salman has been quoted as
saying in a newspaper article recently
that it was a very painful crime and no
one no other country no one should
exploit the crime so we wait to see how
they respond we wait to see how Western
countries respond as well you may be
aware that Joelle Cody's fiancee was
very very critical of Americans for
their response saying that it was an
American it didn't uphold American
values because essentially Saudi Arabia
has got away scot-free but I think there
will be moral pressure now on on
countries to be seen to speak at least
at the very least saying something about
this heinous after that's incredibly our
strident report from the UN Caroline
thank you very much
